questions.question_text:
The human resources department was charged for a cloud service that belongs to another department. All other cloud costs seem to be correct.
Which of the following is the MOST likely cause for this error?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
"misconfigured tags" could be good but not the right solution. Misconfigured chargeback

Selected Answer: B
The most likely cause for this error is misconfigured chargeback (Option B). Chargeback is a process by which the costs of using a service are allocated to the departments or individuals that are using that service. If the chargeback is misconfigured, it could result in costs being incorrectly allocated to the wrong department. This would explain why the human resources department is being charged for a service that belongs to another department, while all other cloud costs seem to be correct.

Selected Answer: B
It's B, chargeback is when company's departments are being charged for their network usage here the other department has been added to the human resources chargeback policy
